front.title: Out-of-Band Certificate and Key Identifier Protocol (OCKID)

abstract.t: In general, certificates need not be communicated with communication orstorage media that are integrity-secure or authentic. This is becausecertificates are digitally signed and users are expected to validate thesignatures using configured trust anchors. However, distribution oftrust anchor certificates, self-signed end-entity certificates, or bare(unsigned) public keys requires a mechanism for establishing theauthenticity of the certificate or public key.
